Literature Review: The sociology of culture is a vast and complex field that has been shaped by the contributions of numerous scholars over the years. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the key concepts, theories, and ideas that have influenced the development of the sociology of culture, with a particular focus on the African context and the intersection of culture with institutions, religion, and the women's movement. Through a critical analysis of the existing literature, this review seeks to identify the major themes, debates, and areas of contention that have characterized the field, and to provide insights into the ways in which sociological research can contribute to a deeper understanding of culture and its role in shaping individual and collective experiences.

References.title: The Sociology of Culture: An Introduction
References.authors: Geertz, C., Geertz, J. D., & Geertz, R. M.
